content.user_title: Create interactive data visualizations with Plotly
content.value_statement: Creating charts and visualizations is time consuming. Plotly provides a Python library with 40+ chart types including scatter plots, heatmaps, 3D plots, and geographic maps. Generate publication-quality interactive visualizations and export to HTML or static images.
actual_capabilities: Create 40+ chart types including scatter, line, bar, pie, and heatmap
Build 3D visualizations with scatter3d, surface, and mesh plots
Generate geographic maps with choropleth and scatter maps
Create statistical charts including histograms, box plots, and violin plots
Build financial charts with candlestick, OHLC, and waterfall charts
Export to interactive HTML or static images (PNG, PDF, SVG)
limitations: Requires Python knowledge and pandas DataFrame familiarity
Static image export needs kaleido package installed separately
Mapbox maps require Mapbox access token for some styles
Interactive features require web browser or Jupyter environment

output_examples.input: Create a heatmap showing correlation matrix with annotations
output: A heatmap visualization where the z values form a colored grid
Each cell shows its numeric value as text annotation
Color scale transitions from blue (negative) through white to red (positive)
Hover tooltips reveal exact values when you mouse over cells

best_practices: Use Plotly Express for quick charts and upgrade to graph_objects for fine-grained customization
Apply templates like plotly_white or plotly_dark for consistent styling across figures
Use fig.write_html to create standalone interactive charts that open in any browser
anti_patterns: Avoid hardcoding chart dimensions; use autosize=True for responsive layouts
Do not create overly complex single charts; use subplots to organize multiple visualizations
Avoid default color schemes for categorical data; define clear color mappings

faq.question: What Python environments support Plotly?
faq.answer: Plotly works with Python 3.7+ in Jupyter, VS Code, PyCharm, and command line. Dash requires Flask under the hood.

faq.question: How many data points can Plotly handle?
faq.answer: Performance varies by chart type. Up to 100k points work well for simple traces. Large datasets need aggregation or WebGL traces.

faq.question: Can I use Plotly without internet?
faq.answer: Yes. Install plotly locally and use include_plotlyjs=True for full HTML export. CDN requires internet connection.

faq.question: Is my data safe with Plotly?
faq.answer: Plotly runs locally in your Python environment. Data never leaves your machine unless you explicitly share exported HTML files.

faq.question: Why do my exported images look blurry?
faq.answer: Increase scale parameter in write_image. Use scale=2 or scale=3 for high-resolution PNG, PDF, and SVG exports.

faq.question: How does Plotly compare to Matplotlib?
faq.answer: Plotly creates interactive HTML charts with hover tooltips. Matplotlib produces static images faster. Use Plotly for web and Matplotlib for publication.
